heisigComment: * When used as a primitive element, the meaning of rice field is most common, but now and again it will take the meaning of brains from the fact that it looks a bit like that tangle of gray matter nestled under our skulls.
heisigStory: Another pictograph, this kanji looks like a bird's-eye view of a rice field divided into four plots. Be careful when writing this character to get the order of the strokes correct. You will find that it follows perfectly the principle stated in frame 4.
koohiiStory1: A rice field divided into four parts.
koohiiStory2: Ten people use their mouths to eat the yield of the rice fields.
words:
水田(すいでん): (water-filled) paddy field
田園(でんえん): country, rural districts
田(た): rice field
田植え(たうえ): rice planting
田ぼ(たんぼ): paddy field, farm
田舎(いなか): the country, country side
